quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 11 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: 11.1: Angles and Radian Measure
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Introducing angle measurement using radians and conversions

questions.question: Convert $150^{\circ}$ to radians in terms of $\pi$.
Which of the following angles is coterminal with $-60^{\circ}$?
questions.explanation: Coterminal angles are found by adding or subtracting multiples of $360^{\circ}$. $-60^{\circ} + 360^{\circ} = 300^{\circ}$.

questions.question: Identify the coterminal angle for $\frac{11\pi}{4}$ that lies in the interval $[0, 2\pi)$.
An angle in 'standard position' has its vertex at the origin and its initial side along which axis?
questions.explanation: By definition, an angle in standard position starts on the positive x-axis and opens counter-clockwise (positive) or clockwise (negative).

questions.question: A compass costs \$15 and is used to draw an angle of $225^{\circ}$. In which quadrant does the terminal side of this angle lie?
questions.explanation: Quadrant I is $0-90^{\circ}$, II is $90-180^{\circ}$, and III is $180-270^{\circ}$. Since $225^{\circ}$ is between 180 and 270, it is in Quadrant III.

questions.question: How many radians are in a full circle ($360^{\circ}$)?
questions.explanation: A full rotation is defined as $2\pi$ radians, which is approximately 6.28 radians.

questions.question: Find the degree measure of an angle that is $\frac{1}{6}$ of a full counter-clockwise rotation.
A specialized protractor used in engineering costs \$45. It measures an angle of $\frac{\pi}{10}$ radians. What is this in degrees?

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You are speaking the language of radians perfectly.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Keep practicing your fraction reductions for conversions.
scoreMessages.0: Conversion is just multiplying by a ratio. Review the $\pi/180$ rule.
